name: "T"eeing Off for Another Bible Quiz | Religion | 10 Questions

questions.text: What is another name for Dorcas?
questions.explanation:
Tabitha.

	The Bible tells us this in Acts 36 (KJV). She was from Joppa, which today is called Jaffa. it is located in Israel. Acts 9:40 tells us that Peter raised her from the dead.

questions.text: According to Judges 4:14, what mount did Barak come from?
questions.explanation:
Tabor.

	Mount Tabor is located in Galilee in Israel. It is west of the sea of Galilee. The name Barak means blessed.

questions.text: I was impressed to find the word theatre in the Bible not once but twice in the book of Acts. What were the people doing in Acts 19:29 (KJV)?
options: putting on a play in theatre
questions.explanation:
rushing into the theatre.

	The Bible says they were confused. In Acts 19:31 (KJV), the other place where it is mentioned says, "And certain of the chief of Asia, which were his friends, sent unto him, desiring him that he would not adventure himself into the theatre."

questions.text: The Jews of where stirred up the people, according to Acts 17:13 (KJV)?
questions.explanation:
Thessalonica.

	They were not happy that Paul had presented the Gospel there. Today Thessalonica is known as Thessaloniki and is found in Greece on the Thermaic Gulf of the Aegean Sea.

questions.text: In John 18:3 (KJV) it says, "Judas then, having received a band of men and officers from the chief priests and Pharisees, cometh thither with lanterns and ________ and weapons". What word goes in the blank?
questions.explanation:
torches.

	This is when Judas betrayed Jesus. Jesus knew they were looking for Him but still asked, "Whom seek ye"? When they told Him, "Jesus of Nazareth", he told them "I am He".

questions.text: Moses is mentioned in Hebrews 11, sometimes referred to as the Hall of Faith. Why did he sprinkle the blood, "lest he that destroyed the firstborn should ____________ them?
questions.explanation:
touch.

	This can be found in Hebrews 11:28. This is referring back to Exodus when God sent the ten plagues on Egypt. The tenth plague was the death of the first born son. For the Hebrews to be spared this they had to slaughter a lamb without blemish and put blood around the doorway. When God saw the blood he knew to "pass over" that house, hence the holiday known as Passover.

questions.text: In 2 Corinthians 7:4 (KJV) Paul states he's "extremely joyful" in all their what?
questions.explanation:
tribulation.

	Paul had been through a lot but always had joy in his heart. The reason for this was because he knew that, no matter what happened to him, Jesus was the end result. He says in Philippians 1:21, "For me to live is Christ and to die is gain."

questions.text: Psalm 47:1 (KJV) tells us to shout unto God with a voice of what?
questions.explanation:
triumph.

	Although some say David wrote the Psalms, it is not known for certain. And if he did, he didn't write all of them. This is a psalm of great praise toward God.

questions.text: According to Acts 20:15 (KJV) where did they sail after Samos?
questions.explanation:
Trogyllium.

	Paul and others were returning from Greece to Jerusalem. Before Samos they went to Chios. Trogyllium is the ridge of Mycale. It is extremely rocky.

questions.text: In Amos 1:10 (KJV), where did the Lord say he would send a fire to?
questions.explanation:
Tyrus.

	Tyrus was indeed attacked by Nebuchadnezzar who left the city in ruins. It was attacked again later by Alexander the Great.
